question: Pick the wrong one out:
option1: Sutlej originates from Rakas Lake (connected to Mansarovar Lake)
option2: Ravi Originates from Rohtang pass in Himalayas
option3: Jhelum originates from south eastern part of Kashmir
option4: Chenab originates from confluence of two rivers, The Chandra and Beas
answer: Chenab originates from confluence of two rivers, The Chandra and Beas
explanation: The Chenab originates from the confluence of two rivers, the Chandra and the Bhaga, which themselves originate from either side of the Bara Lacha Pass in Lahul. It is also known as the Chandrabhaga in Himachal Pradesh. It runs parallel to the Pir Panjal Range in the north-westerly direction, and cuts through the range near Kishtwar. It enters the plains of Punjab near Akhnur and is later joined by the Jhelum. It is further joined by the Ravi and the Sutlej in Pakistan
